thread.title: Patsy's Inn owner Ron Cito dies at 81
thread.title_full: Patsy's Inn owner Ron Cito dies at 81

author: Allyson Reedy
title: Patsy's Inn owner Ron Cito dies at 81
text: Print When Patsy’s Inn closed last Augus t after 95 years of simmering tomato sauce and rolling out pasta, we mourned a loss on the Denver restaurant scene. Now, we mourn another loss with the passing of Ron Cito, owner of the iconic Italian eatery and grand-nephew of the restaurant’s founders. As Westword reports , Cito died on Feb. 11 at the age of 81. Last summer he talked to The Denver Post about the decision to close the restaurant, saying, “I was hoping I could stay here until its 100 th birthday, but due to health…I just can’t handle it anymore.” Services for Cito will be held Wednesday, Feb. 22 at 2 p.m. at Our Lady of Mount Carmel Church (3549 Navajo St., Denver). For more information on Cito, see his obituary here . 1
